name: Mountain
uniques: Rough terrain
Has an elevation of [2] for visibility calculations
Occurs in chains at high elevations
Units ending their turn on this terrain take [50] damage
Always Fertility [-2] for Map Generation
Considered [Undesirable] when determining start locations

name: Lakes
uniques: Fresh water
Occurs in groups of [25] to [25] tiles
Considered [Food] when determining start locations
Considered [Desirable] when determining start locations

civilopediaText.text: Lakes provide fresh water to adjacent tiles, allowing farming where it would otherwise not be possible (similar to Rivers and Oases).

name: Oasis
uniques: Fresh water
Rare feature
Only [All Road] improvements may be built on this tile
Only [All Trade Route] improvements may be built on this tile
Only [Polder] improvements may be built on this tile
Always Fertility [4] for Map Generation
Considered [Food] when determining start locations
Considered [Desirable] when determining start locations

civilopediaText.text: Oases provide fresh water to adjacent tiles, allowing farming where it would otherwise not be possible (similar to Rivers and Lakes).

name: River
uniques: Doesn't generate naturally
Excluded from map editor

civilopediaText.text: Rivers exist on tile edges, not as terrain feature per se.
Tiles on both sides gain its benefits. These benefits do not stack.
The tile has access to fresh water, allowing farming where it would otherwise not be possible (similar to Oases and Lakes).
Movement across rivers takes all remaining movement points of a unit unless there is a bridge.
When attacking across a river, the attacker gets a -20% strength malus.

name: Great Barrier Reef
uniques: Must be adjacent to [1] to [6] [Coast] tiles
Must be adjacent to [1] [Grassland] tiles
Occurs on latitudes from [10] to [70] percent of distance equator to pole
Neighboring tiles will convert to [Coast]
Occurs in groups of [2] to [2] tiles
Tile provides yield without assigned population

civilopediaText.text:
The largest silica sinter deposits ever found on this Earth, on the shores of Lake Rotomahana in New Zealand/Aotearoa.
Lost below the waters of the lake in 1886 due to an auspicious eruption.
The map I based the tile on, halfway down page
